intro: Rumex olitoria, commonly known as garden sorrel, is a perennial herb native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are rich in oxalic acid and have a tangy, sour flavor. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with reddish stems and small greenish-yellow flowers that appear in late spring. Its leaves are often used in cooking, particularly in salads and soups, while the roots can be dried and used as a herbal remedy. The plant thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in gardens and along stream banks.
